source /etc/bash_completion: it's right there, just not enabled by default
the version that's in bash is very simple.  i used to use fc3 and it has a complete support for cvs, scp, ssh, etc
many packages include their own /etc/bash_completion.d/* stuff
if you want completion for cvs, install cvs
but a problem which i'm not sure it's a bug
"cvs co <TAB><TAB>" doesn't read CVS/Root and just works if i use the ENVVAR
"cvs co <TAB><TAB>" doesn't read CVS/Root and just works if i use the ENVVAR
i'm not sure it's a bug
